title: There has to be some shit in the system that declares a certain number of deaths as inting
body:
Make the number required lower per elo, I.E, 40 times in Iron is an int, 20 times in Diamond is an int, this rule cancels out if the game is 30-35 minutes or longer.

If your dying 27 times in 25 minutes in Diamond your inting

People have bad games but 40 deaths isnt a bad games, its someone running it down

replies.body:
a couple of reasons this wouldnt work IMO:

- feeding =/= intentionally feeding, therefore number of deaths is actually irrelevant. you could be 0/100 but still attempting to win the game, as well as be 2/4 and still be inting.
- not even in iron games can people consistently manage 40 deaths to justify it as the threshold.
- if you tell a troll the threshold of punishment, they'll just avoid it. intentional feeding isnt black and white, actual trolls play it smart. its the entire reason the term "soft inting" exists.

I have to say, exaggerating your numbers for trying to win is not helping your actual point: in order to reach 0/100, that game would have to reach almost 90 minutes minimum, and you'd still basically have needed to fight them at literally every point in the game as soon as you could in a do-or-die "Leeroy Jenkins" scenario.

That also brings into account the question of when it's considered intentionally feeding to attempt to fight enemies while *massively* behind, but even ruling that question out, to reach the minimum of 90 minutes, 0/100, this would involve constantly diving the enemy looking for murder, and that in and of itself is explicitly counterintuitive of someone trying to win.

I'd reckon a guess that a 0/100 game of the unluckiest-but-most determined person/team in the world would last well over 3 hours...and probably crash the server.

Let's settle on agreeance that if you're 0/100 in a game that doesn't break your zone's server for awhile, you're most likely inting.

You know what "int" is short for? Intentional. 

Number of deaths doesn't matter. Someone can die twice on purpose and be inting. Someone can die 15 times while having a bad game and not be inting.
